page.title: 08Davenham By-Pass
page.content: The Davenham by-pass is planned to take heavy morning traffic, lorries and cars, going to and from Middlewich, Winsford and Crewe away from the village. There are advantages and disadvantages with each of the 4 alternative routes. For instance the green route is the most direct but destroys seven houses and is the most expensive (Â£3.1m). The three red routes destroy only one house but increase the travelling distance by approximately 1.1km and require extra road junctions. Route C is most likely to be the one used because of reduced cost (Â£1.7m) and limited effect on the environment. Most people asked were in favour of the by-pass. Shopkeepers generally felt that the by-pass won't effect trade too much (but they still don't want it!).
